member.name: IMofCompiler.CompileBuffer
member.summary: The IMofCompiler.CompileBuffer method compiles either a buffer containing binary MOF data or a text buffer in ASCII format. Binary MOF files contain parsed data and must be stored in the database. The CompileBuffer method only accepts multi-byte character arrays (string buffers) that are not NULL-terminated.
member.param: Size of the data pointed to by the pBuffer parameter.
Pointer to the binary MOF file data or a text buffer in ASCII format.

param.name: ServerAndNamespace
param.para: Name of the server and namespace.

This parameter is ignored unless the pBuffer parameter points to a text buffer. If the text MOF is passed without a #pragma statement, then the MOF file is compiled into the default namespace. If pBuffer points to a binary MOF file, then the ServerAndNamespace parameter must be NULL.

param.name: User
param.para: Name of the user requesting the service.

This parameter specifies the credentials for compiling on remote computers. If the value is NULL, then the user context is whatever the current process is using. This is always ignored when connecting to the local computer. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.param: Specifies the credentials for compiling on remote computers. If the value is NULL, the authority context is whatever the current process is using. This parameter is always ignored when connecting to the local computer. For more information, see the Remarks section.
Specifies the credentials for compiling on remote computers. If the value is NULL, the password of the current context is used. This parameter is always ignored when connecting to the local computer.

param.name: lOptionFlags
param.para: You can combine one or more of the following flags.
Performs only a syntax check.
If the method is successful, it adds the file name to the list of files to be compiled during automatic database recovery.
This flag cannot be combined with the namespace, class, or instance flags.
Sends various useful messages to the console.
Prevents the addition of the file to the list of files to be compiled during automatic database recovery.
This flag is not compatible with WBEM_FLAG_AUTORECOVER.

member.param: This parameter is ignored because the binary MOF file already contains the information. The parameter value should be 0.
Ignored because the binary MOF file already contains the information. The parameter value should be 0.

param.name: pInfo
param.para: Pointer to a that describes an error.
If the parameter value is not NULL, an error has occurred, and the structure is filled with error information.

member.returns: This method returns WBEM_S_NO_ERROR if successful. If the method is unsuccessful, it returns WBEM_S_FALSE.

member.name: IMofCompiler.CompileFile
member.summary: The IMofCompiler.CompileFile method compiles a MOF file (including binary MOFs) and stores the information in theWMI repository. This method performs the same operation as the Mofcompcommand.
member.param: The name of the file to be compiled.

param.name: ServerAndNamespace
param.para: The path to the default namespace where any classes or instance are written.

You can specify a namespace on a remote computer ("\computer\root", for example). This value can be overridden by the #pragma command and should not be used if auto recovery is desired. If NULL, then the root\default namespace on the local computer is the default.

member.param: A value that specifies the credentials used to compile on remote computers. If the value isNULL, the user context is whatever the calling process is using. This is always ignored when connecting to the local computer. For more information, see the Remarks section.

A value that specifies the credentials for compiling on remote computers. If the value isNULL, the authority context is whatever the calling process is using. This is always ignored when connecting to the local computer. For more information, see the Remarks section.

A value that specifies the credentials for compiling on remote computers. If the value is NULL, the password of the current context is used. This is always ignored when connecting to the local computer.

param.name: lOptionFlags
param.para: A parameter that, when theCompileFile method is used, enables the combination of one or more of the following flags.
Performs only a syntax check.
If the method is successful, adds the name of the file to the list of files to be compiled during automatic database recovery.
Be aware that this flag cannot be combined with either the namespace, class, or instance flags.
Sends various useful messages to the console.
Prevents the file from being added to the list of files compiled during automatic database recovery.
This flag is not compatible with WBEM_FLAG_AUTORECOVER.

param.name: lClassFlags
param.para: The flags that control the creation of classes.
Parameters may be 0 or a combination of the following values.
Prevents creation of a class.
You can combine this flag with either WBEM_FLAG_UPDATE_SAFE_MODE or WBEM_FLAG_UPDATE_FORCE_MODE.
Allows only class creation.
You may not combine this flag with the other flags.
Updates the class unless conflicts exist.
You may combine this flag with WBEM_FLAG_UPDATE_ONLY.

Updates and resolves conflicts wherever possible. Using force mode to update a static class results in the deletion of all instances of that class. Force update on a provider class does not delete instances of the class.
You may combine this flag with llnstanceFlags.

param.name: lInstanceFlags
param.para: The flags that control the creation of instances.
Parameter values can be either 0 or one of the following flags.
Only allow updates.
Allow only new instances.

param.name: pInfo
param.para: Pointer to a that describes an error.
If the parameter value is not NULL, an error has occurred, and the structure is filled with error information.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.
Warning that #pragma autorecover statement is not present. This statement should be one the first line of the MOF file.

member.name: IMofCompiler.CreateBMOF
member.summary: The IMofCompiler.CreateBMOF method creates a binary MOF file. File creation is accomplished by parsing a regular MOF file and storing a binary representation of the classes and instances into a special file format. Typically, this data binary large object (BLOB) is stored as a resource in an executable file, which can later be extracted for a call to the method. The IMofCompiler.CreateBMOF can also be used to create a localized MOF file (.mfl).
member.param: The name of the text file to be parsed.

Binary MOF file: The name of the file in which the resulting binary MOF data is to be stored.
Localized MOF file: The BMOFFileName string must contain the following comma-separated values:
a<locale>
Specifies the locale information. This value must start with a preceding comma. For more information, see the description of the -ADMENDMENT switch for the mofcomp utility.
n<filename.mof>
The name of the file in which the resulting binary MOF data is to be stored.
l<filename.mfl>
The name of the file in which the resulting localized MOF data is to be stored.
For example, BMOFFileName=",aMS_409,nmyFile.mof,lmyFile.mfl".

param.name: ServerAndNamespace
param.para: The path of the default namespace, where classes or instances are written.

You can use this parameter to specify a namespace on a remote computer ("\computer\root", for example). This value may be overridden by the#pragma command and should not be used if you use autorecovery. If the parameter value is NULL, the root\default namespace on the local computer is the default.

param.name: lOptionFlags
param.para: You can combine one or more of the following flags.
Performs only a syntax check.
Sends various useful messages to the console.
Performs additional checks on the resulting binary MOF file using the WMIMOFCHK program, which is part of the WMI section of the Windows SDK.

param.name: lClassFlags
param.para: The flags that control the creation of classes. The parameter value may be 0 or a combination of the following flags.
Prevents class creation.
You can combine this flag with either WBEM_FLAG_UPDATE_SAFE_MODE or WBEM_FLAG_UPDATE_FORCE_MODE.
Permits only class creation.
You cannot combine this with other flags.
Updates the class unless conflicts exist.
You can combine this flag with WBEM_FLAG_UPDATE_ONLY.

Updates and resolves conflicts when possible. Using force mode to update a static class results in the deletion of all instances of that class. Forces an update for a provider class does not delete instances of the class.
You can combine this flag with lInstanceFlags.

param.name: lInstanceFlags
param.para: Flags controlling the creation of instances.
The parameter value may be either 0 or one of the following flags.
Permits only updates.
Permits only new instances.

param.name: pInfo
param.para: Pointer to a that describes an error.
If the parameter value is not NULL, an error has occurred, and the structure is filled with error information.

member.returns: This method returns WBEM_S_NO_ERROR if successful. If the method is unsuccessful, it returns WBEM_S_FALSE.

member.name: IMofCompiler
member.summary: TheIMofCompiler interface, implemented by Mofd.dll, provides a COM interface that is used by the Managed Object Format (MOF) compiler and any other applications that compile MOF files. Objects defined as classes in the MOF files can be obtained using the CLSID_MofCompiler CLSID value.
